history.content: The answer to this question will depend on what sort of workload you're used to handling in the past, but I would say that 61C+100+188 sounds doable. 100 and 188 are indeed easier CS upper divs, and you will probably find that 61C takes up most of your time. I personally think that combining 61C and 170 will be harder than putting 61C+100+188 together, just because both 61C and 170 demand many hours a week. 61C and 170 is still possible though and many people have done it before. Lastly, I would not recommend taking 16A+16B simultaneously just because you might have to spend many hours a week doing lab for both classes, and 16B obviously expects that you carry in knowledge from 16A as a prerequisite. Good luck!

children.subject: Thanks @Anon. Poet for your comment! By 16A/16B/170, I meant one of 16A, 16B and 170- sorry for the confusion. But since I am going to be taking the semester online, I am not completely sure if doing a p.set based class like these 3 will be advisable as I needed to work with friends to get through 70. This is why I am confused.

history.content: Question as in title. Considering taking 100, 188 and 61C along with a light breadth. Though I have never done 3 technicals earlier, I have heard 100 and 188 are kinda light, so I thought it would be a good idea to take these 2 together during a semester where I am taking 3 technicals. Was initially considering 16A/16B/170 (tilting towards 170) but I don't want to do it online. Can people provide feedback on both the workloads (ignore 16A and 16B for now) and give suggestions. Thanks!
history.subject: CS61C + DATA100 + CS188 + Light Breadth VS CS61C + CS170 + 1/2 Light Breadths
